Reviews.Title: “Good value near downtown, convenient from airport”
Reviews.Author: Luke V
Reviews.Content: Looking for somewhere inexpensive and convenient to the airport to sleep after a late night arrival and plans to leave early for Sedona the next morning. The Budget Lodge fit the bill, and was clean, comfortable, and convenient. Rooms were secure, but rear parking lot was dark, and I was a little concerned about heading out there late at night, after a homeless guy hit us up for money right in front of the parking lot. All in all, though, the hotel met our needs, and I would return again if I were looking for a cheap overnight.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: MajM3
Reviews.Content: the rooms are very clean, the beds are comfortable. The place is quiet and very well located. On our whole trip from San Francisco to Phoenix, this was the best motel to stay. Thank you Dan!

Reviews.Title: “worth the money”
Reviews.Author: merentiana
Reviews.Content: if you want a place to stay near downtown at a convenient price, budget lodge is the deal...the rooms are clean, the place is quiet...the bus station is really close to the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: C_Oswald
Reviews.Content: The Lodge is located in the old Downtown of Phoenix- Theater's and Restaurants, Nightlife and even the Tramway is in walking distance. The Room was very clean and quiet. A very warm welcome from the owner, who realy cares for his guests. Just stayed two nights- next Time again!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Conference Lodging”
Reviews.Author: Babyboomer45_9
Reviews.Content: Clean basic lodging in two story (no elevator) motel. Dan is a real gem-helpful in every way. Comfortable, quiet and plenty of closet space for two. My roommate and I had no problems walking to the convention center, and in the area: a great deli, very nice Thai restaurant. If you brew your own coffee or tea, bring cups to use in microwave unless you can get by with small paper ones.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Indeed”
Reviews.Author: Sergio G
Reviews.Content: Great location, minutes away from the Orpheum Theater. Excellent service, good wireless internet, quiet and clean, looks much better than the pictures online.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Frugal Traveler”
Reviews.Author: Marybeth N
Reviews.Content: This hotel lived up to what previous reviewers have said. I was in town for a conference but needed a clean, quiet place where I could store a little food and have a simple meal while on the road. Next time I will remember to bring a box of cereal as I am not much for muffins/coffee cake in the morning. But I appreciated the fruit and coffee. I will stay here again next time I am in town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: paulette b B
Reviews.Content: Myself and my group of friends stayed 3 nights. We were welcomed by friendly, courteous staff. The rooms were very clean, comfortable and up to date. The parking was ample. The price was amazing and the motel was located just a 10 min. walk from our event at the conference center. We made great use of the microwave and fridge. All in our group were well taken care of and all commented that we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: Pawel K
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for mountain biking on Arizona Trail and visiting Grand Canyon. I had to shipped bike to the hotel and next store boxes and some parts during my bike riding. Dan was friedndly and helpful. The room was clean and has everything what is needed. The location is also perfect, close to downtown and great cibo pizza restarant. There is also beverage machine in the hotel with good prices (75c/can) which is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “You will not regret staying here!”
Reviews.Author: Armin Z
Reviews.Content: Whenever we come to Phoenix,this is our first choice to stay.Everything is very clean and quiet and we feel completely safe.It is a short walk to downtown and there is a nice park close by. All this at a reasonable room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: payogie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a downtown Phoenix conference. The room was clean, bed was comfy and the staff very friendly. Bus stops are very close by... Or, you can take a short walk to downtown. Can't beat the rates for convenience!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay/ Great Rates”
Reviews.Author: RML333
Reviews.Content: Dan is a very personable host. The rooms were very clean and everything seems to be well maintained. I appreciated the low rates as I am a traveler with a small budget. My companions and I walked from the motel to the convention center downtown (about a 10 min trip) both day and evening and felt safe doing this even at late hours. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: R M
Reviews.Content: Convenient location, comfortable room. JA's description hits the nail on the head, and good to know re: Metro from airport for next trip (might be cheaper than the shuttle)

Reviews.Title: “Dans the man”
Reviews.Author: SML66
Reviews.Content: Super deal, very comfortable. Hard working staff. I will stay their during spring training next year.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Location”
Reviews.Author: J A
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect if you want to hang out in downtown Phoenix. No rental car necessary, very easy to get to this hotel from the airport via the Metro. Looks a bit ghetto from the outside, but the rooms are very high quality and some of the best FREE wifi I've ever had in a hotel. Very friendly front desk people too.

Reviews.Title: “very clean and neat but needs improvements”
Reviews.Author: gunfighter06
Reviews.Content: room was very clean and tidy staff was nice and helpful but seemed distant and preoccupied and the king size bed was quite difficult to sleep on as it was extremely hard

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stay for next day airport departure”
Reviews.Author: Noelito2012
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night prior our next day flight out of Phoenix sky harbor. Room was impressively clean and well kept. Our king size bed was comfy and they even had a mini fridge and microwave for extra convenience. Service upfront was also helpful in suggesting directions to car return and nice addition of security features being in downtown location. We missed breakfast so cannot comment.

Reviews.Title: “Spartan, clean, good value”
Reviews.Author: Jay W
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend while we vacationed in Phoenix. The hotel is spartan, but very clean and a good value. It was within walking distance to many activities and restaurants in downtown Phoenix. My only complaint was that the "breakfast" seemed more like a pre-breakfast snack to me (donut or apple and coffee) and wasn't available until 7 (we were up at 6 sometimes). We also had our windows open at night and heard the rabble across the parking lot most nights.

Reviews.Title: “Business stay”
Reviews.Author: Claudia T
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean, close to downtown, good price and good service. I was there three times for work.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Lodge on W. Van Buren St in PHX”
Reviews.Author: O S
Reviews.Content: Excellent service at a good price. Motel was well kept & clean. Breakfast was fruit and a roll. There are some characters roaming around at night but motel is secure.

Reviews.Title: “convenient, clean, and good value”
Reviews.Author: Bonnie B
Reviews.Content: This is a small motel a few blocks from the light rail and about 3/4 of a mile walk to the convention center. The motel is clean, well-maintained and quiet. The room had a refrigerator and microwave. The only thing I missed was a hair dryer. Great price compared to the hotels closer to the convention center. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “simple, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: april o
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Budget Lodge was very pleasant. I was surprised at how nice the rooms were and I wasn't afraid of sleeping on a dirty bed. Everything was very clean. I would definitely stay here again. Great low rates and location.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend to anyone”
Reviews.Author: SouthernLogger
Reviews.Content: Budget Lodge met all our expectations. The motel has an excellent location for downtown and airport accessibility. It is crisply clean and secure. Dan accommodated our specific needs for travel with my elderly mother graciously. Our trip included stays at nearly a dozen motels. Budget Lodge was among the best.

Reviews.Title: “Dan will take good care of you”
Reviews.Author: Beth J
Reviews.Content: What a welcome relief to find a cheap, clean, comfortable hotel AND to be treated with such care. No need to EVER stay in a chain hotel/motel in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “sunverfe”
Reviews.Author: Susan U
Reviews.Content: This is one of the cleanest and most secure places we have stayed and the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “cute mom and pop lodge”
Reviews.Author: Schmeff
Reviews.Content: I did not know what to expect, but I really enjoyed my stay! I was very pleased with the service and the cost of the room and the cleanliness of the whole place. I would absolutely return and recommend others if they were looking for a fair price and a quality room.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: Annachoice
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean and the hotel staff were very helpful and friendly. We were just in town for the night and needed a convenient place to stay. I would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Downtown!”
Reviews.Author: SEtravelerguy
Reviews.Content: At first this hotel doesn't look that great - it's a few blocks west of downtown and the area isn't very vibrant and the exterior of the hotel looks a bit dated and tired. However, once inside it gets so much better! The staff is very friendly and attentive. The hallways are a bit bland and sterile but the rooms are great! You can tell they are very well maintained and it looks like they were relatively recently updated. The carpet and bedding is extremely clean and looks new. The air conditioner/heater works very well and having the fridge and microwave in room is an added bonus (I had friends staying in a much more expensive hotel in the heart of downtown and they didn't even have those). The bathoom, while a bit small, is very clean and again looks newer. The shower pressure is just fantastic and you never ran out of hot water. I would highly recommend this hotel if you're looking for a cheap place to stay in downtown. It's only a 10 minute walk right down the street to the heart of downtown where the restaurants, convention center, and more are located.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, great value,”
Reviews.Author: rlcollier3
Reviews.Content: We definitely were not expecting this hotel to be as nice as it was. The location and price were deceiving because the room was great and the service was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: JROC1386
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a conference for 4 nights and it was awesome! room was cleaned daily and fresh towels were provided(they were slightly on the small side so a new one each day was nice) they were very friendly and the room was large and very comfortable compared to other places we looked.

Reviews.Title: “cheap and clean”
Reviews.Author: mgl6979
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd time staying in this location. Both times I was in town for Spring Training. The area near the motel is not too nice and there are really no places to eat, grab coffee, etc with in close walking distances. However, most of downtown Phoenix seems to be this way. It is not a very happening city at night. That being said if you are just looking for a base (place to sleep) then this motel will work fine. The price can't be beat. That is #1. you pass through the lobby to go to the rooms which is nice being that it is in a bad area. The rooms themselves are very clean and taken care of. Bottom line is that this a bare bones motel but it is cheap and clean. They say they have breakfast but that consists of a few granola bars and a little fruit. So if you need a cheap place to stay that is clean I do recommend it. If you are looking for anything more you would want to try something else..

Reviews.Title: “Great inexpensive motel”
Reviews.Author: Liz G
Reviews.Content: Awesome price for a few nights in March when every other motel jacked up their rates for Spring Training. Super clean and safe. The bathrooms looked very recently upgraded. Microwave and fridge included in the room. Coffee, juice, fruit, and wrapped pastries for breakfast. Walking distance to everything downtown. Friendly, helpful owners.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value!”
Reviews.Author: Gunguy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here when my wife ran a Marathon race. Outside looks like most independent cheaper locations, not that appealing. First impressions are not always true. Inside has been completely remodeled. No...it's not a Hilton...but everything was clean, it worked, plenty of hot water, nice beds. What else do you want for a place to sleep? There was some noise from other rooms and people who were a little loud...but that was from the tile in the hallways. I don't blame management for the rudeness of others. Owners were very helpful with everything from places to eat to getting my net connection resolved. Would stay again if we go to another event down there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Madonna C
Reviews.Content: First time in Phoenix, Budget Lodge Downtown Phoeniz, was a real Clean, Safe, Great place to stay. Will stay there next time I'm in Phoenix, AZ

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel in the desert”
Reviews.Author: Mark L
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently to Phoenix for business and I have found a Jewel in the desert, The Budget Lodge Motel. I booked with them because they are locally owned and operated and within walking distance to the light rail and the Down Town/Convention center area. The management is friendly, the rooms have been updated and are always clean. An added bonus is how reasonable the rooms are, after all the word “Budget” is in their name. I have already stayed multiple times and will defiantly be staying at The Budget Lodge Motel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great locations, great service, great price!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mrod1423
Reviews.Content: I was extremely pleased with my stay. Manager was helpful and attentive to our needs. Highly recommend! Great walking location to all the great places to see in Phoenix! The room was clean and everything was functional. Did I mention it was cheap to stay...it gave me more shopping money! Whoo hoo!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the price”
Reviews.Author: TucsonAndrew
Reviews.Content: We booked here to walk to a show at the Crescent Ballroom two blocks away. It was clean and quiet and everything worked well (shower, TV, etc.). The manager was very attentive and clearly concerned about our experience. The neighborhood is actually pretty cool--we walked to dinner and breakfast too and there were cafes on the way. An inexpensive way to experience the somewhat elusive charm of downtown Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Victer702
Reviews.Content: It was very close to downtown. Everything is close to get to.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: David W
Reviews.Content: Nice, Clean, Comfortable, I came up for a concert at the old Dodge Theatre, which I found out was only a block and a half away and was close to all of what downtown Phoenix has to offer. I will defintly be back.

Reviews.Title: “A horrible experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: Yvonne T
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at this motel the night before we went to Phoenix around 11pm for the following day. It was my fault I didn't check the E-Mail confirmation because this confirmation stated that I booked the same night (which I didn't). When we arrived in Phoenix, the manager couldn't find our reservation. After some minutes he told us that our reservation had been for the night before and that he would charge us that night because we didn't show up. We couldn't believe what he was saying. I asked him how it could be possible to make a reservation at 11PM for the same night? But he wouldn't help us with anything and sent us away. He charged us the whole rate and we didn't even see the room!! I'm sorry but for me good customer service is something else. We had to stay some other place instead which meant double costs and ruined our vacation. I never ever did a bad review before but this Motel really deserves it. They were so unfriendly it's just unbelievable!! I didn't get the chance to see the room we had to pay for but what I saw was the reception which was dirty and there was this really strange smell in there. The location might be close to the city center but I don't think that this is a safe area. I saw a lot homeless people on the street and didn't feel very comfortable. So probably it wasn't to bad that we stayed some other place.

Reviews.Title: “Thoughtful service”
Reviews.Author: Donna R
Reviews.Content: The great service started even before I checked in! Even my messages were waiting for me. Front desk staff very thoughtful. Motel is within a few blocks of ASU downtown campus and the Central metro rail station. Cost me $1.75 for my trip back to the airport. Couldn't beat the location, price or cleanliness. I was very happy with my budget stay in this downtown Phoenix motel.

Reviews.Title: “Economy Stay in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: Boyce L
Reviews.Content: This place is conveniently located and fairly priced. My room was clean and they have cable TV and Wi-Fi. The "breakfast" isn't much to write home about, but one can't expect too much for the price paid. For those looking for a nice clean place on a budget, this place works just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, very clean, nice people”
Reviews.Author: KandHfromUS
Reviews.Content: Free wi-fi, lots of tv channels and super clean and safe. It was the perfect place to hang my hat on a quick overnight in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Lodge Best”
Reviews.Author: mel150
Reviews.Content: We stay here every time we go to Phoenix. For the price, it's everything you could ask for! It has super clean rooms, microwave, satellite TV, ironing board and iron, free internet. The rooms are pretty spacious especially if you get a room with 2 beds. Location couldn't be better, and parking is free. Walk 4 blocks and you're at Central avenue on the light rail line that will take you to downtown. I haven't looked into it, but I'm sure you could take transit easily to anywhere in town from this location if you wanted to. The owners can seem a little aloof, but just chat with them and you'll see that they're very friendly. If you really hate the smell of curry, you might have a problem, as it's apparent in the lobby, but nowhere else in the motel. I often want to ask if I can buy a meal, because it smells great to me!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and condition”
Reviews.Author: Johannes Y
Reviews.Content: Great location; close to everything; clean; tidy; friendly staff; strong water pressure in the bathroom

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay that is close to US Airway Arena”
Reviews.Author: Sam A
Reviews.Content: We needed to place close to US Airway Arena that wasn't pricey. This was walking distance to the Arena. Very friendly management.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: Steve G
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to blow smoke and say that it was anywhere near the best place I've ever stayed, but it was more than adequate for my needs, and the location was well suited to my needs. The hotel is on the edge of the downtown area, which is kind of upscale urban decay. Not terrible, but not really attractive, either. There was occasional traffic noise, and the passing emergency vehicle...and from my room I noticed a small homeless encampment. Security was pretty decent for the building, so I wasn't too worried about the location. The staff (I'm assuming that it was the owner and his wife) were polite and pleasant, if not overly friendly. The amenities were certainly adequate. The room had a micro fridge, which came in handy for me. The TV was an older tube type (with a taped-together universal remote). The towels were really basic cheapo motel style, but still liveable. The bed had a plastic mattress pad, but it wasn't uncomfortable. The complimentary "breakfast" consisted of a couple of cellophane-wrapped danish, a couple packs of crackers, a few pieces of fruit (all bananas one day, all apples the next), some coffee, and a sort of Tang-like drink passing off as orange juice. I agree with the comments about the smell. I noticed the curry-ish smell right away, and it would come and go at different times. Certainly not the worst thing in the world, but I was feeling a little under the weather, and it was a bit much at times. I'd give it a 3 1/2 if I could. Overall, it was a clean, minimal room at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect price, perfect room with microwave & mini refrigerator, excellent hospitality from Owner. Perfectly clean. 5 stars *****”
Reviews.Author: madmanballer
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 4 times now over the past 2 years. My 9 yes old son and I go to Phoenix for sporting events in the downtown PHX venues several times a year. While there are bigger, plusher resort properties in the near vicinity, none of them are cleaner, safer or more accommodating. The owner, Dan, always remembers us. For the AAA RATE of about $60, in PHX, in January you get a spotless room with microwave, mini refrigerator, hair dryer, walk-in closet, FREE WI-FI, AND more cable Tv channels than I have at home! Its a perfect price and its a perfect place to stay. Perfectly Safe,too and its right next to a fire station, which my son loves! And a Mcdonalds & Circle K, 1 block away. Perfect! You could walk the 6 blocks to Chase Field or the convention center or to a Suns basketball game. Perfect! Hope this helps save you some money. Steve, Tucson

Reviews.Title: “Great for the budget”
Reviews.Author: Sandy Y
Reviews.Content: Not bad... Friendly staff... Im used to vacationing in fine resorts and hotels, so I may not be the right eprson to rate this place. We stayed here since our friends recommended it, and we wanted to make this a low-cost outdoors vacation. We were staying the night and passing through to Sedona and Grand Canyon, so we decided to keep it with the theme of vacationing o a dime. It's pretty clean for an older hotel. Be sure to ask for nonsmoking if you prefer nonsmoking otherwise you may get stuck with a smoking room, and it's really smelly to me since I'm a nonsmoker but they try their best to maintain it. For a quick one night stay and traveling on a dime it's better than Travel Lodge! If you're on a budget... This is it!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT VALUE!”
Reviews.Author: IchiroK
Reviews.Content: The 5 stars is based on a Budget Classification. However, this motel is an excellent value. We were in Phoenix for the Arizona R&R Marathon. Our second floor room tucked away just past the far stairway was absolutely spotless. My sinuses and lungs are very sensitive to strong odors and particulates (disinfectants, latent smoke, etc.) and I was so very pleasantly surprised when I smelled NOTHING when we first entered our room. While there was no sweet aroma, no aroma is second best. The carpeting was in fantastic shape, the bedding was very clean. The only blemish was that the walk-in closet space door would not completely latch but it was not a problem. The fridge and microwave worked fine. The bathroom looked like it was newly renovated. The paint was in great shape, the shower (no tub) was large, and the ceramic tile job was still in excellent shape. The Wi-Fi performed fine, though, I did not try to stream video. We walked less than 10 minutes to eat on 1st Street and continued an additional 5 minutes to the Sun's game at US Airways Center. While the motel is just outside of what would look like "downtown blocks", we felt very safe walking back after the game. Front parking can be tight but we arrived, parked, and walked. It was a Friday night and there were no loud external noises. There is a simple breakfast in a very small area but I cannot comment on that because we did not eat there. The only funky thing was was a plasticy mattress liner under the bed sheet. It did not make the bed uncomfortable and it does not drop a star. Mr. Dan is a nice guy. If I need to stay in the downtown area, I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: satyashah
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 7 nights and it was a very comfortable, clean stay with a friendly staff. The room was clean and had a microwave & fridge. Wireless internet & all other amenities were very good. This hotel is very close to the convention center (4-5 blocks) and close to other attractions. The price and quality is very good compared to some of the high end hotels in the area. When you come to Phoenix, Stay here!! You will be happy!

Reviews.Title: “good and clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: nanai04
Reviews.Content: It was a good room for the price. It was very clean and comfortable. We just stayed for the night but overall it was good and the rooms were a good size.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if you want a cheap clean place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: gypsytravler85
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay when I visited phoenix. The location was excellentand the staff was friendly! I would definitely go back and recommend it to anyone else. It is the best deal for the price, about the same as motel 6 and cleaner also ... You get a mini fridge and microwave in your room ... I have never been to a budget hotel that offers that! The continental breakfast isn't much, but its something! Great great place!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: NZDaveB
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in January in a good sized comfortable room, everything we needed was well provided, reliable Wifi, the coffee and light breakfast a bonus. Centrally located, just a short walk to the centre of downtown Phoenix. Dan our host helpful and obliging. Well priced for the standard of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, Affordable”
Reviews.Author: Mardie33382
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights. Quite. Good location. Comfortable bed. Perfectly clean. No complaints. All our needs were met. What more could you ask? Best affordable motel in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret”
Reviews.Author: BedandBreakfastgal
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this property 3 times in the last year. I almost don't want to tell others how clean, safe and convenient this place is for fear of not being able to get a reservation when I want one. But since the host there, Dan, is so good at serving his customers I must write about my experience here. I am a stickler for details and was pleased that the bathrooms were clean and it seems that this property was recently renovated. Appliances and furniture are in great condition. Although it is on Van Buren we have not had any crime problems. Maybe downtown Phoenix is cleaning up its streets. Porsches, BMWs and Mercedes line the parking lot so people in the know are flocking to this great value property. Great experience. Hope I can get a reservation now!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: Debra B
Reviews.Content: I had a very pleasant experience staying here. The room was spotless and had all the necessities, microwave/fridge, cable TV, wi-fi and continental breakfast in the lobby. Traveling on business, I wanted to stay close to my meeting location which was on the east side of town. The location is central to downtown and is only minutes from the airport. Enjoyed talking with Dan, the owner, who has friends in my home town. His wife made sure I had all I needed for my room. I travel at my expense for business and my company reimburses me at the end of the month, no company credit card here. The cost of this room was within my price range and well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Forth year in a row for the Phoenix Supercross event.”
Reviews.Author: Jeff R
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 4 years in a row and will continue to so. Dan the owner even commented he recognized me & greeted me this year with a smile. Makes one feel at home. As has been already stated by other guests: very clean, excellent care, hard working owner & staff. Is in downtown Phoenix - walkable to all events and food. Bottom line: you can't loose staying at this motel, no way will you be disappointed. Jeff R. P.S. Make your reservations early, like a few months.

Reviews.Title: “Super clean”
Reviews.Author: eeekdog
Reviews.Content: We stay at a lot of motels and, by far, this was the cleanest with the most amenities: blow dryer, ironing board, lotions, etc. Walkable to two neat bars, Ghost bar and Henny's, as well as, the light rail.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: H A
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here overnight in December 2011 while enroute to LA. The hotel was extremely clean, well kept, and the manager was extremely friendly and receptive (and also gave a great recommendation for a Thai restaurant for dinner). We were very comfortable and felt safe in the location. The room was quiet and we were not disturbed by noises from neighboring rooms or outside. The hotel is within walking distance of downtown restaurants/pubs, Hard Rock Cafe, and most importantly, Starbucks. Since the price just absolutely couldn't be beat for all the amenities, we stayed again on our way back to Texas. This place is highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: M-AA654
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here in December 2011, during our visit to Phoenix. The hotel was clean and the personal was nice. The beds were comfortable, the bathroom and shower were clean. Furthermore, the price was excellent for a hotel so close to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: deka775533
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in December 2011 while visiting Phoenix and the surrounding area. This hotel is very well located for Sky Harbor International. It is very clean and comfortable with pleasant staff - and the price is great! Our room was spacious and contained almost everything we needed - microwave, fridge, iron, hair dryer, fantastic shower - the only small thing it lacked was the facility to make tea and coffee. In addition, a more than adequate on-the-go breakfast was provided - juice/coffee/pastry/fruit. Free parking available outside. Should we return to Phoenix we won't look anywhere else

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel: cheap, clean, friendly, comfortable bed, good shower.”
Reviews.Author: baslans
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel: cheap, clean, friendly, comfortable bed, good shower. Close to the centre, free parking. The breakfast is not briljant (not terrible either), but what do you expect for so little money. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jim M
Reviews.Content: The host was very polite and kindly put us in a room away from the traffic. The hotel was very clean and neat and quiet. Breakfast (although we awoke too late to partake) was offered from 7-9 am which was a pleasant surprise. We felt perfectly safe and slept very well. Room included small fridge, microwave and wi-fi. Close to downtown. For those looking for a place to sleep and not wanting to pay an arm and a leg for the high priced amenities which are never used, this is an excellent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Travelwithbump
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Budget Lodge Phoenix for three nights in October while attending the World Workplace conference at the Phoenix Convention Centre (about a 15 mins walk away). While my colleagues blew several hundred dollars a night at the Sheraton, I was hugely impressed by the value offered at the Budget Lodge Phoenix. The rooms are very clean, large and well-appointed. The service is very friendly too. It is simply excellent value for money and I would certainly stay there again should I be in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Peaceful, Perfect for a stay in Downtown”
Reviews.Author: PKen_11
Reviews.Content: Great staff always very helpful. Nice room, recently ranovated, very spacious with microwave, refrigerator, iron board, wi-fi. Phoenix is a beautiful city and we enjoyed our walk to downtown. We went to see baseball game at Chase Field saw plenty of restaurants on our way back and never felt unsafe. My wife enjoyed shoping at arizona center, we loved Mi Amigos the best mexican food I ever had. The price is excellent and cant beat other hotels. In my opinion this hotel was a pleasant surprise. Thank you for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: cld5263
Reviews.Content: My husband and son stayed here for 1 nite as they were traveling from Phoenix to Buffalo. Room was clean and definately a good value for the money. Front Desk person was very helpful in getting things done for me over the phone.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Nathan S
Reviews.Content: Just what I wanted in a budget hotel. Clean, simple, friendly service, comfortable and within easy walking distance from downtown. It's nothing fancy, but if you're on a budget this is a great option. I didn't have any problem with the neighborhood, but it's definitely not a highly trafficked area.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel in a dingy area”
Reviews.Author: howardchang79
Reviews.Content: The price is right, the hotel is fine for the price. The location is sort of scary. Don't wander around here at night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect For Business Trips Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Steve8838
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable. When travelingby myself, this is my choice. Don't spend much time in the room except sleeping. It feels safe, Great bed. Has wall mounted hair dryer. Good value for the price and walking distance to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “kind owners, very nice and clean and super cheap”
Reviews.Author: sean s
Reviews.Content: i just stayed there last night for 1 one night, I was very impressed by the cleanness of the place, the oweners were kind and she helped me with the shower as I was having a blond moment and couldnt figure out how to turn it on :O . The price is my fav part considering its at a very good location.

Reviews.Title: “Homeless drunks sleeping in parking lot and lawn”
Reviews.Author: AHT8
Reviews.Content: I phoned the hotel to let them know there are people passed out in their parking lot and lawn. The person who answered the phone doesn't speak English, so she hung up on me.

Reviews.Title: “Circle To Circle”
Reviews.Author: bergaliaboy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while getting our bikes repaired at Victory BMW. The room were very nice and clean and you even got a balcony for your smelly boots :-)

Reviews.Title: “Super”
Reviews.Author: Mqualls
Reviews.Content: This is a clean hotel that offers standards amenities at a very good rate of $45 per night. I thought that the room was really excellent for the price. I've stayed at many large national chain hotels in the past and this hotel offers pretty much the same thing at an even lower rate! Great place to stay. Good light breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: kpocampo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights. Upon check-in, the owner gave me a cold bottled water which was greatly appreciated after the 4 block walk from the light rail on a 113 degree day. I requested a king room but got 1 queen, I didn't complain. I'm sure they would have switched rooms but I was too tired and hot to move. The room was very clean with a newly updated bathroom. It was very quiet too. The morning continental breakfast was a great treat on the way out the door to the Convention Center. I grabbed a fruit and some Tang. ( My daughter was staying at the Hyatt and was not provided with any type breakfast )Also, FREE WIFI-gotta love it! (Again, the Hyatt didn't have this.) I had a great rate with AAA. The money I saved I spent at restaurants. One thing that bothered me was the area. I felt like I should be back in my room by dark. The church across the street had a sign that said something like this: "Please don't sell or use drugs outside this holy place.") I'll be back next year though.

Reviews.Title: “We crossed the us and this is , hands down, the best choice!”
Reviews.Author: Martaalbuquerque
Reviews.Content: Since the second we walked in we were in such good hands. I've never seen people so polite and kind and making such a big effort to make us feel home. Excellent motel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: 3nails4me
Reviews.Content: I was on a 5 day business trip at the Phoenix Convention Center. The hotel was very clean. The rooms had nice carpet and furniture. The price was excellent and the walk to the convention center was about 6 blocks - around 10 minute walk. The owner, Don, was very helpful and his wife had hot coffee and a piece of fruit available each morning in the small check-in lobby. I was very satisfied and will use the Budget Lodge again when I travel to Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “If I stay in Downtown that's where I'm staying”
Reviews.Author: Kristartek
Reviews.Content: As a courtesy at this motel they offer coffee, fruit and patries every morning

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value”
Reviews.Author: Kanaman
Reviews.Content: The Budget Lodge Downtown Phoenix is nice and clean and located a few blocks from the downtown core. The room had a large enough fridge. The neighborhood felt perfectly safe. The Super Shuttle from the airport was $13. I later realized that this was actually unnecessary, since the metro light rail station is only five minutes' walk from the motel and will take you to the airport which has a free shuttle to the terminals. My main point for improvement would be to get a quieter air conditioner - the one in the room was too noisy for sleep. I read in the other reviews about breakfast and wifi. I was not told about them when I arrived, but also didn't think to ask. Overall a good budget stay.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: mathstud
Reviews.Content: My initial thoughts about this hotel included why the price was so low given the great reviews. I found out why when I arrived. It is located in a less than desirable neighborhood. I can honestly say that I was scared to go outside. The office clerk sits behind a bullet-proof window. There are electronic locks on the doors to prevent street wanderers from coming in. However, the room was very clean. The bed was comfortable. The internet connection was reasonable. Restaurants aren't too far and are in better parts of town. Make sure you don't leave anything in your car and you better have a car alarm. Otherwise, it was acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “A basic no-frillls motel near downtown”
Reviews.Author: Bern666
Reviews.Content: This is a basic no-frills motel in the semi-seedy part of the downtown. Their website implys that they are near the airport, but they are not. Needless to say, there is no airport shuttle, but they were good enough to arrange for a 4AM limo ride that got us to the airport for only $18.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: DonNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: The Budget Lodge is a no frills motel, and you can't beat the price. Our room was clean, the bathroom was spotless, and the bed/pillows were comfy. We did have a problem with hot water coming out of the cold water tap, but they came up immediately to fix the problem, which is all you can ask. There is a 'fridge in the room, which was convenient. The Manager did give us a map of the downtown area, which is less than a ten minute walk. The Budget Lodge was very close to Chase Field, as we caught the Phillies vs. the D'backs. I did not realize there was breakfast, but Starbucks is right down Van Buren so that's not a problem. The walk from downtown late at night might be an issue for some. We live in NYC, and it was odd to see NOBODY out walking. Again, it was not a big deal to us, but just wanted people to know that the area might seem isolated (if you were a single traveler). However, buses do run on Van Buren, and altho we walked it is possible to get a ride right to the hotel. It is a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, clean motel with great access to downtown and Roosevelt neighborhood, but crummy site.”
Reviews.Author: bsimosd
Reviews.Content: We had stayed here for Spring Training in March since it was a lot cheaper than hotels near the ballparks. Initially, we were intimidated by the immediate neighborhood, since it was all commercial and with rather shady people hanging out day and night. Once we discovered the Roosevelt Historical Neighborhood one long block north of us, our attitude changed. Two restaurants in restored old houses - Ciba and Local Breezes - were awesome drinking and dining spots. On a recent trip in April we again stayed in the motel, since we were going to Chase Ballpark for a game. It isn't advertised, but manager Dan puts out fruit and dry munchies every morning, along with juice and coffee for snacks.

Reviews.Title: “no frills, but clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: greengirl011
Reviews.Content: I was in phoenix at a trade show, and didn't want to spend $200 / night, so I tried this motel. I am a 49 year old woman, I stayed there alone, and was very comfortable walking back and forth to the convention center, even though the immediate area looked a bit run down. I never had a problem, and the room was quite clean - not musty or run-down. The bed was comfortable, TV worked, and I had plenty of hot water for my shower. I wasn't looking for frills, and didn't get any, but I only spent $54 per night, which was much easier on my wallet. The office had coffee, orange juice, and some type of donuts. Didn't eat the donuts, but the coffee and juice were both fine - although I would have liked real milk with my coffee.... but it got me started til I could get to Starbucks! The manager was professional, helpful and friendly, gave me a map of downtown, and I felt that if I had had any complaints, that they would have been addressed. For a simple motel, I give this place 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room, not the best service”
Reviews.Author: SydneyTravelBug3
Reviews.Content: The Budget Lodge in Phoenix had a comfortable room and bed. It was extremely well priced and close to down town, however it has some drawbacks. The service was poor – they called us ten minutes prior to checkout to make sure we were checking out – and we were told that breakfast was available in the morning. Breakfast consisted of just a few snack bars and juice, rather than cereal or anything more. There wasn’t a breakfast table either. The bathroom was clean but there were no towel racks, or a guest services guide. We’d recommend staying here as the rooms are nice and the price is right, but we may look elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: mgiff
Reviews.Content: Great accommodation, super clean & neat, has aircon, fridge and microwave, free high-speed internet, basic continental breakfast, very helpful staff. Location is 4 blocks walking distance to city centre and 10 mins drive to airport. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Phoenix Conventions”
Reviews.Author: Squooter
Reviews.Content: I stayed for five nights while attending a trade show at the convention centre downtown. It was a pleasant ten-minute walk each morning. From the outside, it doesn't look great, but the rooms are very clean, they seem recently updated, everything worked in the room, and the daily service was professional. The people running the Budget Lodge are also very nice and helpful. Best part? Your convention colleagues are paying prices 4-5 times greater than you are by staying in the name-brand hotels. I would definitely stay at the Budget Lodge again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for downtown”
Reviews.Author: TheScubaDuo
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as we were going to the MLB event and it was only a 15 min walk away which was great. The hotel is clean and basic but seemed like a hospital with long indoor corridors. The service was friendly and quick. £35 for the night

Reviews.Title: “Clean, considerate, noisy”
Reviews.Author: dbrauer
Reviews.Content: The owners are very conscientious. The place is white-glove clean. And for $60, the price is fine. The biggest demerit for us was a noisy bathroom fan (couldn't turn the light on without the fan sounding like a jet taking off - they're on the same switch. There was also a surprising amount of hallway noise (also from a fan) and you can definitely hear the traffic on Van Buren. The breakfast shouldn't factor in your decision: coffee, oj, donut, apple. Again, it's sixty bucks, but plan on buying breakfast if you're a breakfast eater.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great owners, great price”
Reviews.Author: ILoveAlpacas
Reviews.Content: Based on Trip Advisor reviews, my colleague and I spent 2 nights at this hotel. We were skeptical, due to the low price, but believed the good reviews. They were absolutely right! The hotel rooms look recently renovated, very clean, nice bath, ironing board/iron, microwave and frig in the rooms. Coffee, juice and snacks served in the morning in the lobby. Quiet neighborhood, near downtown and most major attractions. As 2 females, we felt very safe. Ask for an upstairs room...they come with a nice balcony. Sure, it overlooks another hotel and parking lot, but nice anyway. The owners are very cordial. The first morning we were there, the coffee wasn't ready when I went downstairs. A few minutes later, we received a phone call from the owner's wife to advise the coffee was ready. I just checked out of this hotel this mornng and felt it very important to post this comment as soon as I could.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel centre of Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: cencible
Reviews.Content: We stopped here for our first night stay in US after flying into Sky Harbour Airport. This was our first taste of American hotel rooms, huge, spotlessly clean, and superbly equipped. There were also mini doughnuts to help yourself to in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Purfect for our business trip!! Not many places like this out there.”
Reviews.Author: bigthinkers
Reviews.Content: We strongly dislike spending money on hotels when we are away for business when you basically only sleep and shower there. (By the way the bed was comfortable and the shower was awesome! ) The room was super clean!! It was within walking distance to downtown & Arizona Center. Dan, the manager was very helpful and accommodating. Room had small desk. Refrigerator and micrwave included.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, Affordable & Wifi Oh My!"”
Reviews.Author: dreamEast
Reviews.Content: The Budget Lodge in downtown Phoenix at first glance may not look the most inviting with its tiny lot and dated signage but don't be fooled. What they don't spend on a blingy exterior, they put towards cleanliness, security and basic comfort. Entering the modest lobby I was immediately surprised at how bright and clean the tiled floors and carpet were, no musty odor at all. The room was equally surprising. For less than $60 a night, we got a king size bed, cable tv, heat/air unit, tiny fridge & microwave (wow!), efficient stand-up shower w/ hair dryer, closet with iron & ironing board and wireless internet! The room looked and smelled clean, the bed was comfortable. What a great deal without sacrificing comfort and cleanliness. We stayed at this place based on previous Trip Advisor reviews (thank you!) Support this place for its great value but also because it's not a chain and we need to support the small business owners.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, pleasant, friendly place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Canadians_554
Reviews.Content: We were in town for the Rock and Roll Arizona Marathon, and found the location of the Budget Lodge downtown to be a perfect location. We were not disappointed with anything, whatsoever. The management team was very accommodating and friendly. We would definitely recommend this hotel to others and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a good, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: johnpeso
Reviews.Content: I came into town for the Phoenix marathon and needed something that was close to downtown without it breaking the bank but also wanted something that was clean and good hotel. The Budget Lodge met all my expectations in cleanliness and amenities, very good for the price. Complimentary breakfast and free Wi-Fi were nice. The walls were a little thin but I was able to get a good nights rest. Would recommend to anyone, a good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “A superb choice for budget-conscious travelers”
Reviews.Author: WarEagle2011
Reviews.Content: I read great things about the Budget Lodge prior to my trip, and I was not disappointed. It is a very well-maintained, family-owned/operated hotel. The staff was super friendly, the facility was in great condition, and the room was very clean. The complimentary breakfast was meager (coffee, OJ, bananas, and donuts), but satisfactory for a cheaply priced hotel. The neighborhood isn't the greatest (lots of homeless people wandering around at all hours), but the hotel itself seems pretty secure (no access to interior or exterior rooms without a key card). For the price compared to other hotels in the area, the Budget Lodge can't be beat! I strongly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as good as other reviewers have posted”
Reviews.Author: Howie089
Reviews.Content: This is a simple basic motel within easy walking distance of the convention center. I measured it at 8 blocks. The room was spotless and as comfortable as any large hotel chain. The shower was powerful, the bed comfortable and the free WiFi was appreciated. I asked for a quiet room and was given one at the back, although I guess that even if I had overlooked the street there was little traffic at night. The hotel is a few blocks from the light rail station and it was an easy ride to the airport for $1.75! My only concern was walking in the almost deserted streets at night but I did not encounter any problems. I would have appreciated it if there was a convenience store or supermarket nearby to put food in the fridge, but it was not a viable walk at night. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: lvpropguy
Reviews.Content: I will say this, the owners are working on it, and have worked hard to clean up the rooms. Very clean and safe hotel, great location downtown. Fridge, microwave, bed, phone and towels...that's it in the rooms. No alarm clock, very few power outlets, no pen or paper...nothing. Breakfast from 7 to 9 is small. But for the price, it's a place to sleep. Oh...bring your own water...the tap water is undrinkable!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, like other reviewers”
Reviews.Author: ArielDunWright
Reviews.Content: We got there after dark but I had no qualms: it was well lit, it's on a main street, you can park right in front of the office. We were checked in quickly, given our room key ( my one pan - the keycard was in an obviously re-used paper sleeve). We found our room (103) clean, the room appeared to have been recently repainted, the bedding was clean, the bathroom was also clean. My wife liked the shower, though small, it had a nice soft spray. There is a fire station on the side-street (4th St.) but it was totally silent the night we were there. I'd stay there again. Good value for the money; clean; easy to find.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, clean, friendly people”
Reviews.Author: anjelita13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here en route to the Grand Canyon from Tombstone, it's about the halfway point. I have lung problems, so we couldn't stay near the Canyon because of the elevation. The bathroom was spotless and new, the beds were adequate for one nights stay, the staff (I think it's all family) was very friendly. The breakfast was something like granola bars and coffee. Not a great location, but after viewing the rest of Phoenix, I don't really think there are any nice locations there.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury shower!”
Reviews.Author: Sidney_Martini
Reviews.Content: A good investment. We'd read the reviews on TripAdvisor and got everything we expected. Clean, comfortable, affordable place to stay and a convenient location. The unexpected bonus was the new bathroom with luxury shower. It was as good as you'll find in many 3- and 4-star hotels! The staff was kind and helpful, even remembering us on our return trip a week later.

Reviews.Title: “Bang for the Buck”
Reviews.Author: ANDILY
Reviews.Content: As seasoned travel agents my husband and I were looking for a simple inexpensive room to use as our central location to see various areas around Phoenix. It was a wonderful experience for only about $53 per night & still within walking distance of hotels charging in excess of $200. Dan (the owner/manager) and his wife were gracious hosts, helpful & accommodating in every way. For example, when we returned from a day out and couldn't get a space in the lot, Dan moved his car to enable us to access a parking spot on hotel property. Has any other hotel manager done that for you lately? The breakfast, though modest, gave us a good send off each morning and the rooms were spotless. Microwave, refrigerator and wireless internet were added bonuses. All in all, we came away with a very positive feeling about this property especially in light of the economical rate. Would definitely stay there again in the future. Emily

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a travelor on a budget”
Reviews.Author: jd18t2
Reviews.Content: stayed 3 nights to attend 3 baseball games at chase field. Was about a 10 minute walk to the stadium, room was spacious,CLEAN, no bugs. Had a microwave,refrigerator and tv. Hotel is kept up good and if you get hungry theres a mickey d's right down the street. Also close to the arizona center for food/movies.10 minute drive to phoenix zoo so def. plenty to do. Neighbor hood is fine, at first looks kinda shady but it really isnt. Nice hotel staff, gave us water after we walked back from a game so that was nice. I would def. recommend this hotel, no reason to stay downtown and pay 200 a night when u can get a better deal at this place.

Reviews.Title: “very nice, clean economical place in Phoenix, AZ”
Reviews.Author: Reise-Kraut
Reviews.Content: The Budget Lodge Downtown in Phoenix, AZ is indeed a very nice, clean and economical place to stay at. I would go there again any time without hesitation. The W-Lan is remarkably fast. The bed is hard enough to get some good sleep! The breakfast offered leaves room for improvement. This, however, would not keep me from going there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value if you want simple accomodation”
Reviews.Author: OntarioCanuck
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great value, rooms are clean and well kept but very basic (no clock) and may not be for everyone. Staff were helpful, breakfast VERY basic (coffee, Tang, some fruit, donoughts), area around hotel is a bit seedy but I felt safe. Nearby MoDonalds, and several nice restaurants within walking distance. Also easily walked Chase field for a night game. I'd stay again but it is not for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, comfortable, clean, great value!”
Reviews.Author: maizeySouthDakota
Reviews.Content: The room was very comfortable and exceptionally clean; Better than most rooms in hotels we've stayed in that were part of hotel chains. The location was very convenient in that it was within 10 minutes walking distance of the Phoenix Convention Center. We felt safe as we stayed here and walked. Coffee and Donuts, & fruit were excellent in the am. Dan and his staff were gracious and accommodating. They gave us a safe place to keep our belongings when our business mtgs. lasted longer in the day and we had a later flight. Thank-You Dan for your fine hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: elwoodp
Reviews.Content: NIce hotel: Very clean has microwave and fridge and very cheap: 55$ However its in a scary section of town. Dont get room 111 as theres a homeless guy who sleeps with his cart outside your window Many transients loitering the streets in this area

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable”
Reviews.Author: ddi92234
Reviews.Content: I booked my room based on the reviews and was amazed when I got there. The whole place looked new. Must have been a total remodel of the motel to make it so nice. Rooms were large enough, microwave, refrigerator and wireless internet. Host Dan was fully versed in the area and was able to give me turn by turn directions so that I could find a men's store to buy a tie. This was even though the store was new in the downtown area. However, be advised that Phoenix is NOT the place to look for stores within the city center. The city center is mostly the university and banks/offices. Very quiet downtown - they must roll the streets up after 6 PM.

Reviews.Title: “Very neat ,clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: mamielee
Reviews.Content: Conveniently and centrally located in the downtown area. Staff was very helpful. Room was clean and comfortable. Continental breakfast with coffe juice and pastries was okay. Very good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: ppjw
Reviews.Content: Clean , safe and friendly. This is a great budget hotel. the building and our room was very clean. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The location is safe and close to downtown. My wife and I had a great stay, there are two very nice places to eat two blocks from the hotel. This is an excellent budget motel not a full service hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Value for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Steve8838
Reviews.Content: I had read a couple reviews on this place before I booked my reservation. They were pretty positive and I agree. The place is clean, friendly staff, cable, wireless, little breakfast in the AM and close to where I needed to be downtown. I stayed for 5 days and the place is quiet and met my needs. Be sure to look down the street and you will see a MacDonalds. You may not think it's a big deal, but they have coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive & clean place, 7 blocks from convention center.”
Reviews.Author: blastrjak
Reviews.Content: Inexpensive and exceptionally clean place, with wifi, continental breakfast and very close to the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised at the great value!”
Reviews.Author: alwaysgrateful1
Reviews.Content: The ladies at the front window were very accommodating and sweet. The entrance/lobby area was very clean as well as the room. When we requested anything they were ready to provide what we needed! I will certainly recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and helpful staff/owners”
Reviews.Author: LindaOttawa_Canada
Reviews.Content: We read about this small place on Van Buren St. Phoenix on trip advisor and because of the good reviews decided to give it a try and we were very happy with our stay. When first arriving in town we stayed 5 days. It is close to the airport, near light rail, downtown, lovely new restaurant/shopping complex. The owner is helpful and friendly. Each room come with a fridge and microwave.The place is very clean and nicely renovated. It is a very good place to stay for a modest amount so we decided to say another night on our return. It is good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: stonedjorgy
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel last November but did not realize I had made a mistake with the dates until I arrived in Pheonix. The manager was very accomodating in finding us a room. This is probably the cleanest hotel I have ever stayed in. You could tell as soon as you walked into the room that they take pride in having a clean hotel. The place is not fancy by any means but well worth the value.

Reviews.Title: “Worth place”
Reviews.Author: SammBoston
Reviews.Content: The room is very clean with wireless internet access and cable TV (including HBO). Even it is situated in downtown area, it was very quiet during night time. There is also no grocery shop and restaurant on the way to the light rail station, which is only a 5-minute walk distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for staying”
Reviews.Author: moveon_next
Reviews.Content: My colleage and I came for a meeting in Phoenix, and we were happy that we chose Budget Lodge. It's great value for the price. The rooms are clean and spacious, and people are nice and helpful. The location of the inn is convenient, in the walking distance to places of interests in downtown. There are a lot of wonderful resturants in the neighbourhood as well, such as Pizzeria Bianco. In fact, since Budget Lodge is so close to the downtown, one can call the free downtown shuttle service to go to other places in downtown rather than taking a cab.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: rmorgan456
Reviews.Content: large, clean room in great downtown location. dan (proprietor) was very eager to meet my needs and make my stay comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “This motel was very convenient, the people hospitable and courteous.”
Reviews.Author: tescbs
Reviews.Content: The motel is very convenient to my office where I worked as well as the airport. The staff was very courteous and hospitable. My room was taken care of daily and I had no complaints. I would definitely return here to stay again when the time comes for another trip to Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for money”
Reviews.Author: lvera
Reviews.Content: The is a clean basic hotel which offers good value for money. If you are looking for no frills accomodation then I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “We ended up at the Clarendon for almost the same price!”
Reviews.Author: pinkdaisy79
Reviews.Content: This was not at all what i was expecting from the rave reviews everyone has left for this place. Yes, i love saving money on a hotel room, but not at the risk of my health or safety. In the short distance from my car to the check in desk i was nearly accosted by homeless person and had to take cover as i heard gun shots that sounded like they were directed right at me. Finally made it to the front desk, whew...we're safe. So safe, our room or i guess all rooms face the Fire Department that is just across a small street. Just as we were getting in our room the sirens sound, just a nice reminder of how close we are to help if we need it, by the look of the place it was probable that we would. Not ten minutes later more sirens blaring out our room only it's 4 cop cars that are rushing down the street only to stop a few blocks down. We got a chance to get settled in, as in we sat in our bed instead of on our bed. How old was that bed?? I'm not sleeping here!!! We checked out our next choice was going to be the Clarendon Hotel just up the street, very, very competitive with the price of what we were paying at the Budget Lodge. We should of started out at the Clarendon, this place is beautiful. The rooms were amazing and so cold, a nice change from the stale hot room at the other place. The bed we were told after an amazing nights sleep were the same beds that are used in 5 star resorts, temur pedic. The pool was beautiful, the roof top deck was amazing and the view was stunning. The staff was so friendly and inviting and gave us some great tips on where the locals eat and what's new and exciting in the area. All in all we will be coming back to Phoenix next month and you can bet we will not be staying at the Budget Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: Thomasins
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights while relocating our daughter at ASU downtown campus. We looked at several hotels in downtown, they quoted us $200-$375/night. I would rather buy gifts for my loved ones to take back home then pay ridiculous money for clean and comfortable stay. This hotel was perfect for us. We paid $75/night and got more then we paid. It was close to airport yet quiet enough. Rooms are brand new & spacious, even includes microwave & fridge. Staff was very friendly and helped us with directions. We walked everyday to downtown because everything was practically walking distance inc light rail, convention center, & nice restaurents. We went to the Grand Canyon our last day. Time was short but we hope to catch a concert or a game at the US airways center next visit. I'll be staying here everytime we come visit our daughter. We had a wonderful time in Arizona and enjoyed our stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Met all of our needs”
Reviews.Author: grandmaof8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were attending a convention in Phoenix with our 2 grand children. I was looking on line for a reasonable place to stay when I came across this place. I read all the reviews so decided to book our stay here. I have to say we were not disappointed. The price was very reasonable, the rooms spacious and very clean and there was good room service every day. The continental breakfast was a little skimpy but it wasn't really a problem to us as we had our own provisions and the room had a microwave and a decent size fridge. It was within walking distance of the convention center (about 7 blocks down and 2 over) a little over 1/2 mile. Overall we were very happy and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We had a full schedule and were not looking for a bunch of frills just a decent ,safe ,clean and reasonable place to stay. So if this fits you this is the place. If we were ever in Phoenix again we would definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: adnilasor
Reviews.Content: I needed a place to stay for 8 days and could not afford to pay the expensive prices of the bigger hotels so I decided to stay here after reading the reviews. I am actually still here (its the 6th day now). It is not much to look at from the outside but the rooms are spacious and clean. The owner and staff are courteous and responsive to any needs or requests. There are quite a few travelers who pass through here but the place is quiet. It is close to the convention center and the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: stautxie
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this motel this April and had a very satisfactory experience. The location is very convenient indeed, close to light rail station, airport, and many hotels that are possible candidates for conferences. The service is also far beyond my expectation given its super low rate. In fact, I had had some concern as how clean or how good the service will be given such low rate. But now, I will definitely make it my first choice for my next trip to Phoenix and would not hesitate at all to recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great value downtown”
Reviews.Author: Shaky
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical of the reviews on this hotel, but decided to book anyway. I am happy - and somewhat surprised - to report that this is a very good deal. First, let me say that this is an urban hotel. It's two-stories with no elevators, narrow hallways, and few frills. There is no room service, no spa, no fitness center, and they lock the outside door at night. That being said, it's also very clean. I've stayed at 4-star hotels that weren't this clean. They've obviously just done some renovation, including painting and new carpets (in some places). They have free wi-fi internet that has no problem. My room was fairly big. Nothing fancy, but very clean. As several reviewers have stated, the location is great. We were able to walk everywhere with no problems. The owner is on-site and was helpful without being nosy. They have a small parking lot (where my car stayed during the entire visit) which seemed pretty safe. If you're looking for a clean room at a bargain price, this is your spot.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: civilsavage
Reviews.Content: Everything that other reviewers are saying about this place is pretty much what I'd have to say! In fact, I booked my reservation based on the recommendations of other reviewers on this site. It was everything described! A short list of the things we liked the most: 1. It is VERY close to downtown, the light rail station and the bus depot. And via the metro system, MINUTES from north Phoenix and downtown Tempe. We used it to get to the Botanic Garden, Mill Avenue, and the Phoenix Zoo while we stayed. If you don't mind walking a few blocks, it is within walking distance of the Convention Center, Chase Field, US Airways Arena, the Phoenix Art Museum, and the Heard Museum. 2. The place is impeccably kept and simply laid out. Practically everything you'd need for a few nights' stay if you're not expecting too much and brought most of your own toiletries and whatnot. The stand-up shower might be a hindrance to some, however, but we don't know if other rooms may have had bathtubs. 3. Security is very good and the caretakers keep a close eye on the place so it feels very safe. We were at first put off by the "no visitors" policy but after reconsidering, it is a smart policy on behalf of the other guests' security. Think of it as you would your own house: Would you want uninvited guests in your house? 4. The rooms are modest and have the basic conveniences and we were surprised that they came with a mini fridge, microwave, ironing board and iron. We thought we would have to request those! We did find it a little odd however that the hotel had signs posted that requested 'no cooking' but provided a microwave. We didn't bother to get clarification. *grin* 5. The PRICE was very helpful to us while we were budgeting our week-long trip through Arizona (which included the Grand Canyon, Sedona, and several destinations in Phoenix). If we stayed even at a Super 8 or other budget hotel we'd probably have spent $20-$30 more per night and had to contend with safety issues, a less-than-desirable location, and cleanliness issues. We would and probably will definitely stay here again if we are in the Phoenix area for a few nights!

Reviews.Title: “For this price, it really is that good.”
Reviews.Author: Essellanden
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this website, we decided to book this motel on our AZ road trip. I was a little apprensive, because for this price ($60), it couldn't be that good, right? Wrong. It really is that good. Quick access to and from the freeways. The rooms were quite large and comfortable. Maybe a minor point: if the other guests are a bit noisy, the walls are a little too thin. Otherwise there were no issues. Everything was clean and in good working order. Wifi also worked fine. There's no street noise and the neighborhood's fine. You can park right in front for free and apparently quite safe - we saw guests leaving their luggage on the back seat overnight and it still was there the following morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: jessc2078
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Budget Lodge for one night during our road trip to Arizona. The location was only a short walking distance from the US Airways Arena and the Convention Center. The rooms were clean and roomy. For the price, the Budget Lodge is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault it”
Reviews.Author: Cossack-Andy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first 2 nights of our SE Arizona road trip, and I can't see why anyone on a slightly restricted budget would consider staying anywhere else. Yes, the outside is a bit shabby and the corridors and stairs could do with a lick of paint. But the room itself was very clean, tidy and in good shape. The king-size we had was very comfy, and the room was perfectly large enough; as was the bathroom, which was also clean, and the shower was fine. The coffee was lousy, but that's the same in most hotels in the US. But the owners leave fresh fruit & muffins etc out in the mornings, which is great. Compared to the silly prices other hotels in the area charge, this was great value. And its in a great location. Just over 3 miles from the airport, its a 5-10 minute walk from bars & restaurants, the convention centre, the Phoenix Suns stadium etc (Brits walk - make that 1 minute drive for Americans!!) If you're a tourist, its only just over a mile to the Heard Museum, 15 minutes drive to the Desert Botanical Gardens and just over half an hour to Taliesin West (well worth a visit). Unless you're there for business, meetings etc, a hotel room is just for sleeping and, on that basis, this place is absolutely great value. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: phoenix2009
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on this website when looking for somewhere to stay during a holiday in early March which I took with my 13 year old daughter. Every review on here was positive so I decided to book it. It was indeed an excellent place, although I do have a few small issues. Here are the positives first: The rooms are very clean and spacious, cleaned daily and adequate for short stays. The fridge was very cold and having both fridge and microwave meant we could buy food for the week and store/cook it rather than having to eat out every day. The breakfast is very nice and coffee quite good too. Irons, ironing board and hair dryer all provided on request. Washing machine and dryer on premises of motel next door but accessible to patrons of this motel, very cheap too. Very very quiet, despite being near go a fire station. We slept with the windows open every night and there was hardly a sound the whole time. Manager's wife was lovely and really did all she could to be accommodating. Now my complaints: Despite having phoned twice before our arrival to say that we wouldn't be arriving into SkyHarbor until 8.30 and so probably wouldn't be able to check in until around 9.30pm, when we finally arrived after a long tiring journey from the UK at 10pm the manager commented on how late it was. I told him I'd stated this twice before and he just smiled but ignored this fact. He then wanted me to pay for our stay upfront, which in all my years of staying at hotels I've never been asked. On 2 other occasions during our 9-day stay he asked me when I was going to pay, claiming that he had to pay his mortgage- seriously. He wasn't offensive or overly pushy, and I told him on each occasion that I would pay the day before we left. We had one very heavy suitcase plus 2 other small ones and I asked for help carrying the heavy one. The manager then told me I should have told him this before I came! How was I supposed to know that there was no lift and no busboys or other staff to help with this? In the end he carried it up the stairs for us but I found this quite off-putting. I had booked this in part because it claimed to have high speed wireless in the rooms, so I could talk with my daughter back at home. When we got into our room I discovered that the wireless signal was very poor and the speed infuriatingly slow. I called the manager to my room but his only suggestion was that I wait until the next day when all the "convention people" would be gone during the day and the signal would be stronger, supposedly. In fact I had to re-arrange the furniture and moved the small table in the corner of the room over to underneath the clothes rail and set up the laptop there as the signal at least was better and more consistent there. After a few days of really frustrating and inconsistent speeds and signal, I pulled out my wireless card which was designed for top speeds of 54 MB and turned on the internal wireless adapter that my laptop has which was designed for top speeds of 11MB. Lo and behold it all went much quicker and I was able to upload videos to YouTube in a reasonable amount of time. If I hadn't had this internal adapter it would have made things very difficult. All in all however this is a decent place to stay, fantastic location very close to bus and lightrail and nice area which is very quiet. I loved Phoenix and would come back again and would stay here, I'll just be prepared. There seems to be no staff apart from the anager, his wife and cleaning staff which is again slightly impractical but not the end of the world.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in downtown”
Reviews.Author: kitties3
Reviews.Content: All the other hotels in or near downtown Phoenix cost $150.00 and up. The Budget Lodge is within walking distance of the Convention Center, the sports arenas, city & govt. offices, entertainment, and good restaurants. The hotel rooms have all been remodeled and are roomy, clean, and pleasant --- and the beds are comfortable. Dan, the manager, was most accommodating, suggesting restaurants we could walk to, giving me walking and driving directions to where we had appointments, and assisting me with my airline flight plans. If I return to Phoenix, I will definitely make reservations at the Budget Lodge. I'd rather spend my money on a nice lunch or dinner, and be assured that my hotel is reasonably priced, yet pleasant and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, comfortable and a good location for downtown”
Reviews.Author: RScottNorthDakota
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a place near the Phoenix Convention center that was not as expensive as the main hotels. It was nice and comfortable. Staff was very pleasant and helpful. Within walking distance to most major downtown areas plus only a couple blocks to the new transit system.

Reviews.Title: “A cheap and nice motel”
Reviews.Author: videoslave
Reviews.Content: If you want a cheap and convenient place to live, probably you can choose here. It is clean and it provides basic service. But except for these, you cannot expect any more for such a cheap motel. Another good thing for living here is that you will never miss anything important in the morning, because you will be waked up very early by the traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Pleasedpartner
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with this room. I have stayed in hotel/motels all over the country and this one is great. Rooms have TV's, frig, irons and ironing boards. Beds are comfortable and pillows are full. Rooms are clean; even the corners. The price is unbelievable. You can pay over 4 times more for a room 7 blocks away! This is my third different stay at this motel and it is great every time. I have stayed at the Ritz and for the value and results, I will come back here everytime.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, economical”
Reviews.Author: RoadWarrior073
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an excellent alternative to the larger (and 3x more expensive) downtown hotels. I walked 3 blocks farther to the convention center and saved a lot of money. My room was very clean and well-kept, wifi worked fine, and the place was very quiet overnight. I'll book here again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Lodge Motel, Phoenix, Arizona, downtown”
Reviews.Author: JasonEarthWalker
Reviews.Content: The Budget Lodge Motel in downtown Phoenix, Arizona (402 W. Van Buren Street) is a pleasant surprise. Located only 15 minutes walk from the Convention Center, this motel is clean, quiet, and very reasonably priced. So much so that I was initially skeptical that it would be OK. I need not have worried. The room, with two double beds, was clean, large and well-maintained, with plenty of well-positioned lights, a desk and chair, and a nice TV. Everything worked great. Even the coffee at the complimentary breakfast (with muffins and fruit) in the morning was good. This is not a luxury location. Just a good place to stay, really close to the convention district downtown. The new METRO, with a stop only about 4 blocks from the motel is an added plus. It will get you to and from the airport (about 4.5 miles away) for less than a couple of bucks. Just make sure to buy a ticket and have it on you when you are on the train.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and confortable, with kind people”
Reviews.Author: Khagan_thebest
Reviews.Content: It's in the downtown, near to the convention center where I had to go. It is very cheap, nevertheless it is confortable and the people are very kind. I suggest it to all who doesn't want to spend too much.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Clean Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Willy66
Reviews.Content: I went to a Bridal Show in Phoenix and this motel was my best option, very close to the Convention Center and Restaurants. The room and shower are very clean, bed is comfortable; overall is a great place to stay . Daniel is a great manager, helping with all your questions or doubts and always available. Also the coffee and muffins at morning are great!! Thank you Dan! If i need to get back, I'm sure i will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Very Clean, Low-Cost”
Reviews.Author: WalkerTucson
Reviews.Content: This is a very clean, low-cost motel in the heart of downtown and close to the capitol offices. I was looking for a low-cost place to sleep near the capitol offices. I got a great bed, gracious service, and TV that offered a wide range of TV channels. I've stayed in some very nice places, but for short stays, all I want is a good sleep and some TV to watch. This little motel offered all I needed at a very reasonable cost. If you don't need frills, this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great little downtown motel”
Reviews.Author: whimsis
Reviews.Content: 12/10/08 was my second stay at this little motel in downtown Phoenix. I found it because it is very convenient, (walking distance), to the US Airways Center where I was attending a second concert this year. The rooms are nice, very clean, neat, and bathrooms have new tile and good showers. The rooms have a refrigerator, microwave, and comfortable bed. Mangement is friendly, available, knowledgeable of the area and they even put out muffins, orange juice, etc for breakfast. Fantastic price for the amentities.

HotelInfo.Name: Budget Lodge Downtown Phoenix
HotelInfo.Address: 402 W Van Buren St, Phoenix, AZ 85003
